elements.2211.03296_b7f545257090a93438f3425d37ad4: In addition, previous work has shown that design elements such as color and imagery can effectively influence arousal levels
elements.2211.03296_360446c8756b611cdaa8cde7e4754: , which from another perspective confirms the possibility of conducting research on the relationship between data visualization design and affective arousal.
elements.2211.03296_3eafb8e46b12c20df7ad29d5e7004: Although many researchers have acknowledged that affects are an indispensable part of users' experience with data
elements.2211.03296_3177223b4589e8dce9014f7b17e41: , previous literature has mostly viewed affects as discrete categories rather than examining them in a continuous space.
elements.2211.03296_0f4d44ff2f988e8ee7dac5c7f73ca: investigated people's affective responses to data visualizations by conducting a diary study
elements.2211.03296_789fed421ac31a1597b837de29ed9: The affects reported by the participants were mostly categorical, such as surprise and disgust
elements.2211.03296_2ec3360987dcdfc809f7c8414c30e: focused on examining how data visualization design influences one particular type of affect, empathy
elements.2211.03296_cbbb9f0a50e5aed30e0e1bf2d9bb4: proposed an affective animation design scheme for common charts to convey positive affects such as joy and tenderness in data stories.
elements.2211.03296_af8da943f92e36b6657f1fcffb0f4: However, this study still simplified affects as categories and did not show how affects change in the dimensional space continuously
elements.2211.03296_60b39df3e05fd00ed846b088e5b94: To sum up, although the above work has contributed to our understanding of how data visualization design influences affects, as yet no systematic work has been carried out to address this problem through the lens of affective arousal
elements.2211.03296_db6358f0d6b3dca21b20abbce6b77: To fill this gap, this study first explores what data visualization design factors may influence the perception of affective arousal
elements.2211.03296_2aeaa0471f3befc689ea3fb1831a0: To begin with, we prepared a corpus containing 265 data visualization images based on the MASSVIS dataset
elements.2211.03296_32df66e8183f899244e02c9460b45: Based on this corpus, we conducted a crowdsourcing study involving 184 participants and asked the participants to assess the affective arousal elicited by the designs in the corpus
elements.2211.03296_9946c1adbf20ba716c16ba70ebe04: We then analyzed the experimental results and derived a set of design features that the participants thought related to affective arousal by coding their comments manually
elements.2211.03296_d99be6aaab6238665b0be01c3705e: These design features were grouped into three main categories: color, graphics, and information.
elements.2211.03296_b0dff94da6eed7c96d0ad4ed6f288: Finally, based on all the quantitative and qualitative analyses above, we discuss the implications that arise from our work, reflect on the limitations of this work, and propose future research opportunities.
elements.2211.03296_8b5d104bd72063f38c8636d441367: Affective arousal is about the activation of emotion
elements.2211.03296_d14636c7b2779e23ebf79e0283985: and is viewed as a key construct of human affects.
elements.2211.03296_d2680b839ec65775d0a6c828572ea: For example, the well-known circumplex model
elements.2211.03296_3ff42fa577e5ed74c926fef80f74f: views affects as combinations of valence and arousal
elements.2211.03296_2100c8f65fb404818795a0c777f7c: While valence describes whether an affect is positive or negative, arousal reflects the intensity of the affect, ranging from calm to excitement.
elements.2211.03296_1e91fcaf9fb03bddda99fd098aefa: to the community of data visualization and aimed to understand how design elements influence viewers' affective feelings towards data visualization
elements.2211.03296_b92b90e0a77be32d898aeee7289c6: identified a set of affective color palettes that can elicit eight categories of affects, such as calmness and positivity
elements.2211.03296_6fadbd26b751e33d9944a96267100: investigated one specific category of affects, empathy, and found that using anthropomorphic pictograms to represent human rights data does not help trigger empathy.
elements.2211.03296_3a1a0b638d0a80891efd25a856535: summarized a set of affect-related design factors in infographics, such as the usability of the design and the expressiveness of the design
elements.2211.03296_9bf3ddd4be921b97810cd50ee8ee4: They also explored the dynamic design elements in data visualization design
elements.2211.03296_324f5b5c2d4c16538fd8de5c8a632: and proposed an animation design scheme, Kineticharts, for creating charts that express five positive-valenced affects, such as joy, surprise, and amusement.
elements.2211.03296_e1980578e7d9fd2908f2caf3b39b2: However, although the aforementioned work has laid a foundation for investigating how data visualization design influences affects,
elements.2211.03296_e7b08a68c264439050848c1d1c3e0: To bridge this gap, this work investigates affective arousal specifically
elements.2211.03296_8547021c8e126feaa0a84182264a5: As a continuous measurement, affective arousal helps capture the intensity of people's affective experience with visualization, thus contributing new knowledge around affective visualization design.
elements.2211.03296_fc56874aa80be25368735262c10a1: To identify design factors that contribute to affective arousal in data visualization design, we prepared a corpus of data visualization designs and conducted a crowdsourcing study with 184 participants
elements.2211.03296_acc5b7ea4d41fe43352f5dff8c354: The participants were asked to view the data visualizations randomly chosen from the corpus and rate the affective arousal triggered by these images
elements.2211.03296_ba5a4ef094f9c97a7cc33817077fc: Afterward, we analyzed the data collected from the study to summarize a set of potential arousal-related design features
elements.2211.03296_6ab4c73c7835fe2fa40333e171dce: The study materials can be accessed at
elements.2211.03296_82b972019f7465291e3aa6aabf1d7: We aimed to use a dataset that contains diverse data visualizations and reflects the variety of data visualization design in the real world
elements.2211.03296_82b4bd657630915ac218a4bca80c1: A dataset that meets such needs is the Massachusetts (Massive) Visualization Dataset (MASSVIS)
elements.2211.03296_2cd1abbc67beadcddb4f575b01ab8: MASSVIS has collected thousands of data visualizations
elements.2211.03296_7591d2118b4089b7510b07a58a5fe: : infographic galleries, news media, governments, and scientific journals
elements.2211.03296_00b3cfcac3271e1244506631253a1: and public availability, MASSVIS has been used frequently in previous studies
elements.2211.03296_6803769b895c0013ed8e60d80f47c: MASSVIS is constituted of several sub-corpora with different data sizes and labels
elements.2211.03296_ecffd952052b9cd9ae333f97e31ce: is a corpus that contains more the 2000 pieces of single data visualizations labeled with basic meta-information such as sources and titles.
elements.2211.03296_41e86cb9d0b477e432ca1244be92a: , another sub-corpus, contains 410 representative data visualizations selected by experts from
elements.2211.03296_ea94248d0d4de782d5006e9fb0ff2: It contains a more suitable amount of images to be used in a user study while maintaining the design diversity of
elements.2211.03296_709b1b9de97d6f409e6dda20413e0: has been labelled with more design-related tags, such as the visualization type and data-ink ratio
elements.2211.03296_98a42d0bb327899ae7a49e76d6272: , the semantics carried by a data visualization will remarkably influence people's affects
elements.2211.03296_6953f200bfc69451935b24f1e5133: Many people would react affectively to the content or the topic of a data visualization
elements.2211.03296_c6881e39d613731406c6035abab76: Besides, embellishments such as an illustration of violence and a photograph of a child can also trigger strong affects
elements.2211.03296_96e1bb60ff8c59941e28aac6608b7: Such affects brought by semantics will be confounded with the affects brought by design and thus hinder our understanding of the exact impact of visualization design
elements.2211.03296_89995925e327f6f8d06df5360c516: Therefore, to get rid of the influence of semantics, we blurred all the texts and embellishments on the images so that the participants in our studies could focus on perceiving the affects triggered by design only.
elements.2211.03296_3db0f4ff36aa63f10ffa62020b39d: We used the blurred version of
elements.2211.03296_1c23e54fdcdbc03f6b60305220c1b: as our stimuli and conducted a pilot study to investigate whether it was appropriate to use this corpus in our study
elements.2211.03296_4196224f84ce47ba6cd1c4b04b51e: Based on the findings from the pilot study, we refined the corpus to construct the final stimuli for our crowdsourcing study.
elements.2211.03296_a3a68ddd14892a775749fe072d18b: We recruited 10 participants (7 females, aging from 21 to 26) for the pilot study
elements.2211.03296_a4d8e24c421cf0106ff647d6b52ad: Once entering the online survey, the participants were presented with an introduction to our research, such as the definition of affective arousal and how to use the instrument for evaluating affects, namely Affective Slider (AS, see Fig.
elements.2211.03296_102aabebe088bb2d5c3aca577d19a: AS is a modern version of Self-Assessment Manikin (SAM)
elements.2211.03296_1e28bb2739925bc7b32d2dff41c5e: , which is the traditional instrument for measuring valence and arousal based on the circumplex model
elements.2211.03296_1598a35593ef0c76f903954a21729: for affective arousal, 1 denotes not at all aroused, and 9 denotes strongly aroused)
elements.2211.03296_161a483b183f688afbd8dd6476543: AS inherits the core spirit of SAM but stretches the scale to 100 by providing a movable slider whose range is 0.00 to 1.00
elements.2211.03296_c461913a49064d0d3231eb44dcbe2: Such a scale can produce more continuous and precise data, which is more suitable for use in statistical modeling.
elements.2211.03296_963a221a9577018b044b2e207f742: Note that although this work focuses on arousal, we asked the participants to rate both arousal and valence during the study in case there was any interaction between these two dimensions.
elements.2211.03296_cd4ec8ad8dbdf1abe5fcaca9ba3c0: After reading the introduction, the participants viewed 20 data visualizations randomly chosen from our corpus, one at a time.
elements.2211.03296_cb0bdb97321f456a488efb6359ca1: We also shuffled the order of the 20 stimuli to ensure the participants viewed a random sequence of images
elements.2211.03296_196f694b16bf9267e9638391e8141: After viewing each of the images, the participants rated their arousal and valence using AS
elements.2211.03296_575abb8c60aee00405673d7457d41: They were also asked to provide reasons for their ratings and rate the likability of the design (
elements.2211.03296_35c0aebf24984d14c12709ce5be63: Do you like this data visualization?
elements.2211.03296_4612e97f19928b2b64ef415e396fc: ) using a 5-point Likert scale (1 denotes strongly dislike, 5 denotes strongly like).
elements.2211.03296_9cfb7bb5c1bdd689f8ea2b814c4a7: After viewing and rating all 20 images, the participants filled out a form to answer four demographic questions (
elements.2211.03296_eb0669a9e4f03e10e51d100e64622: gender, age, education level, country) and two summary questions
elements.2211.03296_d09fb7c0303d22f6a1d6ddcba1f96: Please recall the data visualizations you have viewed and list the design factor(s) that helped increase the arousal level.
elements.2211.03296_6be8061e6b6da89d755d0bf6da244: Last, we interviewed the participants with a set of pre-prepared questions concerning the study design, such as
elements.2211.03296_70b2b3bc8163d5e58b9552d0f37b7: Do you think the study instructed you well? Did you feel confused about anything?
elements.2211.03296_98882e2a2cdacccde2e074847bfdd: Do you think 20 is an appropriate number of images to view? Did you feel tired or impatient during the study?
elements.2211.03296_c5361ef79135c0e3442fe6cee2903: Do you think some images are significantly different from others in terms of eliciting your affects?
elements.2211.03296_455dc46e43f85552783180a44d31f: On average, the participants spent about 20 minutes completing this study and 10 minutes on the interview.
elements.2211.03296_e9395d1c3cc8f8bb66b90b5942c27: We collected both positive and negative feedback from the pilot study
elements.2211.03296_7b1fd563260183212ed7e2d15cc2f: For example, most participants agreed that 20 images is an appropriate amount for them to complete the study without losing patience
elements.2211.03296_7f5d0476cf598a8fbb68d15f327de: Also, the participants confirmed that the study task was clear and the whole process was well-guided.
elements.2211.03296_b274591cc11aa7b18443a8d6879ef: However, on the downside, several participants reported that they did not feel confident in their ratings until they had viewed and rated several images (
elements.2211.03296_c62f0f31eb52acf8bd9d8097f9d07: Accordingly, we refined the introduction page by including three examples
elements.2211.03296_a5611dbc4d2bde5c4b3b30fa99fd0: The three examples were selected by a visualization expert to demonstrate the diversity of the stimuli.
elements.2211.03296_88dbb14cf5423777802a1da6d0cd4: We also noticed that there were some problems with our stimuli
elements.2211.03296_bf6de15dacbb857abd465bacbda75: First, many participants reported that the scientific visualizations (see Fig.
elements.2211.03296_4517bf7922b9097f8e1092ab287c9: ) were significantly different from others, since the participants were unfamiliar with such designs and felt these images should only be viewed by professional scientists or expert users (
elements.2211.03296_14d078e5eeee9cda132b9b79aa1ee: Third, several participants reported their discomfort with images that had a large aspect ratio
elements.2211.03296_35c40e2fec0cc2d9e6d228ce1b515: Based on these findings, we removed scientific images, embellished images, and images with an aspect ratio greater than 3:1
elements.2211.03296_1712a5ef7a658b6f07f22c0656f70: However, a consequent problem was that the removal had changed the distribution of the image categories (
elements.2211.03296_f6557008f7021b977623e745afbf6: Infographic, Government, News Media), since many images removed because of embellishment belonged to the Infographic category
elements.2211.03296_0c65c33abfc9acb65215b76963d8e: Thus, the sample sizes of the three categories became unbalanced
elements.2211.03296_9b4e4278e6cdd047f41acffda4e0f: To deal with this problem, we searched the
elements.2211.03296_535c5f288e28def3ce067ad898913: corpus to identify more qualified infographic images
elements.2211.03296_d0cc1f0bf346100ac94a4d9b77339: After including these 63 images in our corpus (which resulted in 265 images in total),
elements.2211.03296_c21f5931ebd8e37bbff1ec0d7fc14: The distribution of the image categories is similar to that of the
elements.2211.03296_3b393d2947d145e388ac8c1b796da: In our crowdsourcing study, we used this refined corpus as our stimuli.
elements.2211.03296_7e6eee37542b58f68918da42e40ec: Then, we conducted our formal study
elements.2211.03296_4e7edbe50c62e20f5e7191b0fb187: We chose crowdsourcing to collect user data concerning the affective arousal elicited by data visualization design and explore design-arousal relationships.
elements.2211.03296_72b28bca34bb2e6f62a1bdf871321: We recruited 184 participants from Prolific who speak English as their first language and have correct vision
elements.2211.03296_d316e6e4333b2f3101a4c84510ff6: We rejected the data from ten participants, as they misunderstood the study task (
elements.2211.03296_a2a817ec0dc619a73223e9f07d235: failed to understand why the texts were blurred and kept complaining about the legibility) or provided data with poor quality (
elements.2211.03296_dd3e4b95c4449eeec8480a04690ad: giving all the images the same ratings without explaining why)
elements.2211.03296_c76bc418eaa2acdd94545ffa777c2: The remaining 174 participants included 98 females, 75 males, and one identified as non-binary
elements.2211.03296_6e9dce6916c97ee55771f033a1c79: = 13.79), and their educational levels varied (Less than a high school diploma: 0.57
elements.2211.03296_6e9065c659c06d7bd5efc1505b5bc: The study procedure of the crowdsourcing study was identical to the pilot study
elements.2211.03296_4606f5447220f21f61b86a5300e88: The participants first read an introduction page, then viewed 20 data visualizations (one at a time), rated arousal and valence, wrote down reasons for their ratings, and rated how they liked the designs
elements.2211.03296_fbef413e3900f031a5939bf5b4733: After viewing and rating all 20 images, the participants filled out a form to provide their demographic information and wrote down what design features they thought contributed to arousal and valence, respectively
elements.2211.03296_e445bfc7fb487a0062d05c4ae1cc9: The participants spent 22.34 minutes on average completing this study.
elements.2211.03296_f057167747aad522787f1152e038f: We got 3480 valid ratings for the 265 images,
elements.2211.03296_c62f25f3b92dc615a7f45f87149be: Each image received 13.13 ratings on average.
elements.2211.03296_e29be5c14126ee8ddf6ca0941ee5d: Overall, the average arousal score of all the images was 0.53 (
elements.2211.03296_43091e40013fb580e2ee9597f478d: , the means and distributions of affective arousal varied in different groups
elements.2211.03296_a675dcc7dcfd206f51a8ca7c738d6: For example, the mean arousal of the
elements.2211.03296_0b071529c246f0babc1cc9fe4a960: category was 0.61, higher than that of the
elements.2211.03296_5d76e43d9dc7adc31f95927803e66: A Kruskal-Wallis H Test further showed that the difference was significant (
elements.2211.03296_f4028cc287149c754cc4040f28471: Dunnâs post-hoc test with a Bonferroni correction showed that the mean arousal of
elements.2211.03296_92c6da6ebb7afd28ab220070ba157: was significantly higher than that of
elements.2211.03296_d723d2b9bd96b7117d5440c8f7682: We also examined the arousal scores set by different age, gender, and education groups
elements.2211.03296_4f9630bec5a047048ed7bf776a1dc: = .376) showed that there was no significant difference between the scores set by females and by males ("Non-binary" was not included because its sample size was too small)
elements.2211.03296_a9f50fbbf0d863507d937014213f6: Then, we assigned the participants into 5 age groups (<=25, 26-35, 36-45, 46-55, >56) and compared the mean scores of arousal set by these groups
elements.2211.03296_1d5128e770b2a898952f3bb614bfd: , the mean arousal scores set by different age groups interestingly decreased with the increasing age
elements.2211.03296_8f8a8d3676b608377f79e72e50d84: A Kruskal-Wallis H Test combined with a post-hoc test further showed that the difference was significant (
elements.2211.03296_77ec9fe026842c138929deb57e310: < .001) and mainly caused by the lower mean (
elements.2211.03296_ef142a4797f39a2a533d19eb3dc76: In other words, in our study, the younger participants were more aroused by the stimuli while the elder participants were generally calmer
elements.2211.03296_b5a35c5fa8b4df6d5a676ba0b5e59: < .001) also existed in the scores given by participants with different education levels ("Less than a high school diploma" not included because its sample size was too small), mainly caused by the higher scores set by participants with a "Doctoral or equivalent" degree (
elements.2211.03296_8cf113004b2dcc1f165be394d7253: However, this finding should be taken cautiously since the sample size of "Doctoral or equivalent" was not big (7 participants)
elements.2211.03296_5717b5a9e6b51239aa7f787c3cb9b: We also calculated the mean arousal score for each image
elements.2211.03296_de6338188b86507fca40ea90ef642: shows the five images that received the highest scores in affective arousal and the five images that received the lowest scores
elements.2211.03296_6a0479f2bb09108d5153eb3718dde: In line with the above findings, the top ranked images all belong to the
elements.2211.03296_95f468f566000d71bdb0cd66ec308: H1-H5) while the low-ranking images mostly belong to the
elements.2211.03296_96f6772b67a101badf6baf1c32ca3: Then, we examined the correlations between affective arousal, valence, and likability
elements.2211.03296_41de534bbc53599dc8d01390f1493: plots the mutual relationships between these three variables
elements.2211.03296_0fe087bf82eea66072fc1ae8efe79: It can be seen from the figure that they generally showed a positive correlation with each other
elements.2211.03296_13014429be57d0b92d2da525740ea: Given that likability is an ordinal variable and all the three variables are non-normal, we used Kendall's Tau (
elements.2211.03296_9316c74b1ed91ff1aff0f4e12147d: ) to compute their correlation coefficients and significance levels
elements.2211.03296_8341df05e115f7c67fbd78dad1ac0: The results confirmed that arousal was positively correlated with likability (
elements.2211.03296_ea8665a4d4fbe43c5cb8413431b39: < .001), whose positive correlation was even stronger
elements.2211.03296_2091928d69218b679103434e58c93: Besides, arousal and valence also showed a moderately positive correlation with each other (
elements.2211.03296_7be360e5da5f5d3ca59ec3d1dc9f7: Note that these correlations still held when we conducted the correlational tests within different image categories.
elements.2211.03296_c9b8c0cbe38a1f93590ac71d078c4: To sum up, in general, high arousal was likely to co-occur with pleasure and high likability
elements.2211.03296_dd36e16c7d341c4d3a7618d10f6f6: However, there were also cases when arousal did not lead to pleasure or when arousal hindered likability
elements.2211.03296_4abfb27b83529ca73b33a80f11c00: For example, as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03296_c1b62a2ee6ff320312b06208bb561: , some participants set scores to "high arousal + displeasure" or "high arousal + low likability"
elements.2211.03296_d21195c13eb259511fe2b3378d48f: We will discuss such situations in detail in Section 5.2.
elements.2211.03296_962383c348f19a1e7153aee56e767: As stated above, at the end of the user study, we asked the participants to write down what design features had helped augment their affective arousal
elements.2211.03296_fdd51b32f048b1f2701a7bd9a512d: This resulted in 174 comments that suggest arousal-related design features from the perspective of users
elements.2211.03296_a9c278935a5339b14dcc6fc7bd936: Then, we conducted an in-depth qualitative analysis on these 174 comments following the bottom-up procedure of thematic analysis
elements.2211.03296_58a0d28ab4bbabe0cb1164e548e80: Two of the authors first went through all the user comments and took notes on the messages deemed useful
elements.2211.03296_5954fa17882984ba026f9c3c537ee: Then, they coded the comments independently and generated possible themes by grouping the codes
elements.2211.03296_5a5a63500cf637a00c75609c48413: After that, they met to compare codes and discuss mismatches
elements.2211.03296_4f736e90bc570834bd3b4a0c30e67: Through iterative discussions, they generated three themes most commonly mentioned by the participants, including
elements.2211.03296_bb2aaf90063b2258cc93957608ae8: Then, they assigned the low-level codes into these three themes and discussed whether to retain, modify, or merge the codes
elements.2211.03296_dc6ea2a53dd504dfec940a6a30424: For example, when describing colors that had strong visual impact, the participants used different expressions such as
elements.2211.03296_2faa6cf5f0534f1ca49132c83b64c: Therefore, these similar expressions were merged into one code, namely
elements.2211.03296_5e53b85afa918fe3cc2f6e81ed19d: It was also noticed that some codes described high-level design strategies rather than specific design features
elements.2211.03296_b406565515fccb57ea4ba25c84d57: can mean simple colors, simple visualization design, or a small amount of data.
elements.2211.03296_e315403128841a71ab1e16c7eef60: can refer to unusual color, unusual shape, or unusual visual encodings
elements.2211.03296_580a16a9575686ee35870e5b73f99: Therefore, such codes were categorized into another theme called
elements.2211.03296_b8fa7c12c71eb8899f631ce0bef17: After iterative discussions, the coders achieved a 100
elements.2211.03296_239f82b92da6d9ce6f9c724a24373: At last, they generated 412 codes from the 174 comments in total
elements.2211.03296_11a5cd473dc7d15a7d7d7692dfa68: The frequencies of all the codes were analyzed and the result visualized, as in Fig.
elements.2211.03296_ce8884afea26e0652fd1a09e76cd8: Note that for the clarity of presentation, codes that occurred only once were excluded
elements.2211.03296_86cfede7e993311602d943a11d6be: Collectively, the codes visualized in Fig.
elements.2211.03296_9049a0f10f651d4d55af9bc34cd7e: Thus, they are highly representative of all the arousal-related design features written down by the participants.
elements.2211.03296_3e03f75f5da39977f0386ce0a8bda: Within the theme of color, 49 codes only broadly referred to
elements.2211.03296_873cd0884e0248d0d5dac20bd5cd4: as a contributor to affective arousal
elements.2211.03296_c750412073cff583107b867e181da: (13) were the most frequently-mentioned specific color features
elements.2211.03296_05a921dc60ccd3f6c818d507942e6: Within the theme of information, 11 codes talked about
elements.2211.03296_4a2bff57ebb5a3182211861cca416: in a broad sense, while six codes specifically referred to
elements.2211.03296_e71b33a83218462824520d4a9c3fa: and five codes specifically referred to
elements.2211.03296_9a6134aa927bb95cf804b0055997e: Last, with the theme of high-level strategies,
elements.2211.03296_ead3a93332377a48f7b9fdec83772: The mappings are summarized in Table.
elements.2211.03296_191b791cd96a7657dc9aaca507f69: using the algorithm proposed by van de Weijer
elements.2211.03296_af3ac6fc34ee1954242c89c288487: This algorithm can identify and calculate the percentages of 11 nameable color hues (
elements.2211.03296_af648ed57d0e33407dc93ba1c1054: black, blue, brown, green, gray, orange, pink, purple, red, white, yellow) in images.
elements.2211.03296_be876b8b3909184efd6e71f72dd73: Information-based features concern the cognitive load of viewing a data visualization and can be further split into two main types: texts and data.
elements.2211.03296_c1d3ab77761a16433cfa8f59421cf: First, although all the texts had been blurred,
elements.2211.03296_684b02e10862a7862d840c020f167: to identify the texts on the images, manually revised inaccurate identifications, and then counted how many words each image contained and the word density on each image by dividing the word amount by the size of the image
elements.2211.03296_2c7e3c6d94558bae2aef1f6c508d1: Next, to quantify the amount of data, we counted how many visual channels were used in each image in total, as well as how many distinct visual channels were used
elements.2211.03296_4552548568c10e54d8fcf2e347e07: We also counted the number of data marks in each image and how many distinct data marks were used
elements.2211.03296_cd90e41330a9c22886620a32f82e8: H2 only has eight data marks while H4 contains more than 100 data marks, but both of them only used one type of data mark, namely
elements.2211.03296_806efc07010c0d56b5e11684c3e93: In some images, the data marks were too many to be counted precisely (
elements.2211.03296_4597ec6305d0fd1da607f5c10bc60: thousands of overlapping dots), therefore, we transformed this feature into a nominal variable with three categories (
elements.2211.03296_a6daad832618ac0c951da5962c94b: The dependent variable is the mean arousal scores of the 265 images, and the design features of the 265 images we extracted in Table.
elements.2211.03296_75e76cb123bef01f5ae75d76e4a77: During the data pre-processing stage, first, we checked and revised empty and mistaken values.
elements.2211.03296_763e5b2982ff2ca932837ec3b41c2: Then, for all nominal variables, we used the one-hot encoder in SciPy to transform them into a set of binary variables that use 1 and 0 to indicate the presence or absence of a category
elements.2211.03296_94f79fcae0c4619ea44cd9f0f9b1e: Next, we tried re-scaling the raw arousal scores set by each participant before calculating the mean arousal score received by each image
elements.2211.03296_463938ab952c669855834ee02624d: This step was done because we noticed from both the pilot study and the crowdsourcing study that the participants showed varied rating habits
elements.2211.03296_6b997fdc4aeb4209d40decf269fa4: For example, even with a very similar judgment of a design, some participants tended to set higher scores to arousal (
elements.2211.03296_02810cc333d3b132948be97413807: 0.95) while some thought 0.70 or 0.80 were already high scores
elements.2211.03296_e608c372f3f60cb9bc7b24a07aaaa: In other words, the participants' criteria of rating affective arousal were differently-ranged
elements.2211.03296_08e7db9b0f249373176021d12e7c6: Therefore, re-scaling the ratings helped mitigate the influence of rating habits and revealed the real judgments of all the participants
elements.2211.03296_a96c6c4aeb6b8a3085c63150eac95: Specifically, we tried two common means of re-scaling, including the z-score normalization and the Min-Max normalization
elements.2211.03296_8cee0a091d8b56913da03fa045514: When constructing the models, we tested the performance of the two re-scaled dependent variables as well the un-scaled version
elements.2211.03296_481c34f3d9bb3acb9e6ef160c540c: Results showed that the z-score normalization method performed the best
elements.2211.03296_ba69260580bbf998fb082ab57ead2: Therefore, we adopted this version of dependent variable when constructing the final models.
elements.2211.03296_5ddccffb315fe595cbf80900cc225: After data pre-processing, we used Pearson correlation coefficients to get an initial understanding of the correlations between the independent variables and the dependent variable
elements.2211.03296_ebf4c64a9c08dc4ed3ae6efd01c48: Results showed that features such as the
elements.2211.03296_f6b3d8902721490cf957a0ba9e03f: < .001) had a significantly positive relationship with affective arousal, while features such as
elements.2211.03296_490cf25388eab2666fd2d85017b19: < .001) had a significantly negative relationship with affective arousal
elements.2211.03296_43ea0915c6075651a8c438eb3746f: High correlations also exist between some design features
elements.2211.03296_48a96958399e3699e05ee44d688ae: (2) conducting multicollinearity diagnostics using the Variance Inflation Factor (VIF)
elements.2211.03296_823bc7dad1fe99fa34291de618d72: A VIF above 10 implies serious multicollinearity and a VIF above 5 is usually deemed problematic
elements.2211.03296_e3e01c7c3512004089fbdf7812919: (3) Ensuring that there was no autocorrelation problem using the Durbin-Watson test (0 < DW < 2); (4) Ensuring that the residuals were normally distributed by conducting the Anderson-Darling test and plotting a histogram for residuals.
elements.2211.03296_59448cea0546469a232858520f96a: Below we discuss the design implications that arise from this work, the possible negative consequences of eliciting high arousal,
elements.2211.03296_93b8a1fe622429f188415802b61df: An interesting finding of this work is that in data visualization design, graphical elements that are related to data encodings showed significant capability of eliciting affective arousal.
elements.2211.03296_a1fefdb5c0f8e97c2747c97b029cb: For the visualization community, this finding is significant in two main ways
elements.2211.03296_29d4cffb76f66efd611e604286a94: First, we have found new evidence that the appearance of data visualization does affect user experience
elements.2211.03296_2bdd158c2a0312ed6005bc3723b80: found that when encoded with identical data, different chart types (
elements.2211.03296_cbe8d572c31dfa015b48f6a2720e0: treemaps and sunburst diagrams) triggered different subjective feelings and preferences
elements.2211.03296_9cf170e4773fe6df9efd2f5e6c760: found that people remembered certain chart types better than others
elements.2211.03296_bb2f711a855d2a3ba9af34b73306c: In other words, choosing data encodings is not only about how to present data but also about manipulating user experience
elements.2211.03296_fb44de75bd6af877b46be81aed2bf: Second, this work also supplements the existing knowledge about user-centered visualization design from the perspective of affective arousal
elements.2211.03296_6acc9342a0d40835a4b681b88fd0b: For example, in the study by Borkin
elements.2211.03296_711479d58ce00cb012605eaac0996: , the most remembered visualization types were
elements.2211.03296_2f0786fed6891bbcf6592f4fc1a15: This suggests that viewing visualization design from the perspective of affective arousal may be different from viewing it from perspectives such as memorability and aesthetics (although these perspectives are all user-centered)
elements.2211.03296_dbda13e3c411122db41fccb221a71: In other words, focusing on different aspects of user experience may also lead to different focuses of design.
elements.2211.03296_a9f77d553199d725b1919b428e411: Infographics are often seen as a visual form that pays more attention to data communication and appealing to viewers subjectively than traditional visualizations
elements.2211.03296_668be65a1efa3d6d99cd7619705fd: has often focused on studying the rich embellishment techniques in infographics such as pictograms, illustrations, and visual metaphors
elements.2211.03296_bd95fa21699f2dc32480303658af1: However, another interesting finding from this work is that even after we removed all embellished designs for our corpus, the images in the
elements.2211.03296_1b07c5c5e1d29f5e54783531955e2: category were still significantly more arousing than others
elements.2211.03296_3bfd186a4486abe8e50bbd4944704: This finding indicates that the specificity of infographic design may not only lie in embellishment, but also in how it deals with color, graphics, and information
elements.2211.03296_5da55d3a1473afff01b241df44b21: As shown by an empirical study
elements.2211.03296_57701a670f4c74161e23a5ab936ad: , when creating infographics, designers often spend a lot of time choosing encoding approaches and polishing the appearance of the visualization iteratively, because the designers not only hope to present data clearly, but also to create something new and unique
elements.2211.03296_257ead2dc60ead81241ec61f4625c: strategy we mentioned above and may help improve the arousing level of a design.
elements.2211.03296_93fd81b69a34ad47afb653183fde4: However, there seems to be controversy over
elements.2211.03296_22db8bc7b368ce5c1caf61c0aa825: (we can see the co-existence of these two strategies in Fig.
elements.2211.03296_536b4756259a6c21c8db2f1b5724e: Our models, however, ended up leaning towards the side of
elements.2211.03296_42ffe8415570b4e246dd0157c6bd1: because affective arousal showed a significantly positive relationship with the
elements.2211.03296_248cf473092524bfe401b8dca7bbb: The Negative Side of High Arousal
elements.2211.03296_915b8a2e2842819f19138fa448de8: As we have discussed in Section 4.1.1.3, in our exploratory study, high affective arousal did not always lead to high pleasure or high preference
elements.2211.03296_7a188b91b34332cf426ee9926be98: In some cases, the participants did not like or enjoy data visualization designs that elicited high arousal, or they thought high arousal was harmful
elements.2211.03296_df81461fa8637b3ec6bd9b68cf29d: By analyzing such comments, we identified two main reasons:
elements.2211.03296_ce2efd830ee6a9120f34229a1b772: In our crowdsourcing study, several participants reported high arousal but thought the corresponding designs were too chaotic and over-stimulating (
elements.2211.03296_b587c645b2fad4d422f4a754c66f3: These findings resonate with prior psychological studies that intense affects may bring about side effects
elements.2211.03296_01f519b287612af3ebee5b1852f32: or even evolve into tension and anxiety
elements.2211.03296_8b16f9f8f75462f2724c959e44b8e: Therefore, for designers, designing an arousing data visualization is not equal to simply adding up all stimulating design features
elements.2211.03296_0523056751cf36e8c8db71c9bb2c0: On the contrary, it is necessary to find a balance between arousing affects and preventing discomfort.
elements.2211.03296_73fe916d0be7365eb12f120d3b454: In some cases, the participants were affectively aroused because the designs looked confusing or ugly to them
elements.2211.03296_94566be44c6a4dd7121c8c17c18d2: For example, one participant said that a design "
elements.2211.03296_8406c3fd824b17d72782bcfe60d12: " We also saw comments that reported high arousal accompanied by negative affects such as anger and irritation (
elements.2211.03296_dc79334a7b0201383268d6bf5f125: Under such circumstances, high arousal is not beneficial.
elements.2211.03296_b5d21d7143f246177d0de858a7548: Understanding what design features contribute to affective arousal has paved a path toward automatically evaluating the arousing level of data visualizations or automatically generating arousing data visualizations
elements.2211.03296_d640a65285a11258e06730e968c88: For example, we can envision a feedback system that can intelligently assess the arousing level of a data visualization design by scoring its design from multiple arousal-related aspects and identifying its strengths and weaknesses, thus guiding designers to improve their work.
elements.2211.03296_5fbbfed311acd42e86e84f419daa6: First, although we have carefully constructed a corpus that contains diverse data visualization designs, the corpus is still by no means exhaustive.
elements.2211.03296_9aa4fff66863956ae100a82ff0d72: Second, affective arousal is a subjective feeling that is difficult to quantify
elements.2211.03296_b78f0f6cabe4ec34faafc3d6b8fc6: To mitigate this problem, we excluded the influence of semantics, sampled diverse participants from a large population pool through crowdsourcing, and normalized each participant's ratings when constructing the models
elements.2211.03296_2a0194e72aa5ce3643b104ec4aab5: However, noise caused by subjectivity may have inevitably entered and lowered the accuracy of prediction.
elements.2211.03296_8316a9c3fe0ad3c2d8d5f2ead5f0b: Third, the features we extracted in this work are not exhaustive and are limited in characterizing some high-level subjective concepts such as aesthetics and unusualness
elements.2211.03296_0b8c141d51ba5703bc0f4e8c0d678: We see several directions for future research
elements.2211.03296_960099c18965f3084d14b8dc46500: Last, we hope there will be more research into how we should take advantage of the benefits brought by affective arousal and how we should avoid its negative side effects.
elements.2211.03296_cac3ce5e1685c054e2ee7e7d8f861: First, we collected a corpus of 265 data visualizations and conducted a crowdsourcing study with 184 participants to gather ratings on the affective arousal elicited by their design
elements.2211.03296_ca11e50ab96dc1a6f90664be8d5da: received her Ph.D. degree in design from Tongji University, China, in 2022.

elements.2211.03296_b366a249c05ee00d8ad9c93483e17: She conducts interdisciplinary research across fields such as data visualization, data journalism, digital communication, and design
elements.2211.03296_b7e87208e43e5fe8fdc2b0c16de84: Her research interests include data-driven storytelling, visualization design, human-computer interaction, and visualization for the masses.
elements.2211.03296_9e7ba708a5d39263d75c43c33f913: received her MA degree in design from Tongji University, China, in 2022

elements.2211.03296_e9df3a76ad5401ece07f14c40e028: Lab), the College of Design and Innovation, Tongji University, Shanghai, China
elements.2211.03296_2c3a87e690899d2d86518d436cdfb: Her research interests include data visualization design, intelligent user interfaces, and human-computer interaction.
elements.2211.03296_161fa7f9723911499b5b3cc2fb9de: received her B.Eng degree from the Department of Computer Science, Zhejiang University and her Ph.D. degree from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST)

elements.2211.03296_615aa8464a2dc614e2e2ba7928e3f: received his Ph.D. degree in Computer Science and Engineering from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST), Hong Kong, China in 2012
